title: Carnival Third-Quarter Profit Rises
text:
By Patrick Thomas

Carnival Corp. (CCL) said its profit rose for its third quarter as revenue grew nearly 12% from a year earlier.

The world's biggest cruise operator reported a profit of $1.78 billion, or $2.58 a share, compared with $1.71 billion, or $2.41 a share, a year ago. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $2.53 a share.

The company reported adjusted earnings of $2.63 a share.

Revenue rose to $6.53 billion from $5.84 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected $6.21 billion of revenue in the quarter.

Write to Patrick Thomas at patrick.thomas@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 26, 2019 09:59 ET (13:59 GMT)
